been speaking of the fetus merely as a person, and what I have been asking
is whether or not the argument we began with, which proceeds only from
the fetus being a person, really does establish its conclusion. I have argued
that it does not.
But of course there are arguments and arguments, and it may be said that I
have simply fastened on the wrong one. It may be said that what is important
